Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2014 06:46PM 521grammy wrote: Dear rita22 My heart goes out to you.  Please consider yourself hugged.  My diagnostic mammogram on August 29th came back as a BiRad 4C.  It showed a cluster of linear microcalcifications in my left breast at the 1:00 position which were not shown at all in my last routine mammogram in January 2014.  I was scheduled for a biopsy on September 3rd.  I was extremely lucky and received my results only 24 hours after the biopsy.  All samples taken were benign!  Praise God!  However, the waiting was brutal!  I spent a lot of time on the internet which only added to my angst.  My husband begged me to stay off the internet.  I tried to stay busy but my mind was always on the "what if's."  I spent a lot of time reading posts on this forum and I'm sure I read several written by women who received BiRad ratings of 5 and still received benign biopsy results.  My 4C rating was just a bit less than a 5 and all 8 samples taken by my doctor were benign. While waiting for my biopsy and results, I kept telling myself that 80% of biopsies are benign.  I wish I could do more for you than just tell you my story.  I pray that you find peace during the waiting--both before and after your biopsy.  I'll keep looking for you to post updates and will keep you in my prayers. 521grammy
Posts.Title: BI-RADS 5 rita22 Miah-xx

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2014 04:11AM 521grammy wrote: Dear racingheart I had a mammogram in January 2014 and was called back in for more testing because of density in my left breast.  I had a sonogram done during that follow up appointment and was told that it was just a cyst--nothing to worry about.  However, they wanted me to follow up in 4 months.  I kept putting off that follow up appointment but finally went in on August 22nd.  Again, I was called in for further testing.  However, even that further testing which was done on August 29th indicated that the cyst had not changed and still was not a problem . . . but there was some microcalcifications showing up that had not been on the mammogram in January.  I had a stereotactic biopsy on September 3 and received results on September 4--all benign.  I know exactly what you mean about being overwhelmed.  My best advise is to stay off the internet.  The waiting is brutal.  Reading all the information on the internet just makes the waiting more brutal. Try to stay active and positive while waiting for doctor appointments, etc.  Seek love, support, and peace from your friends and family.  Check back here often as there are hundreds of women going through exactly what you are going through and each one of them will be supportive of you.  Keep us posted on your journey and consider yourself hugged.  Warmest regards. 521grammy
Posts.Title: I have results but still confused racingheart racingheart

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2014 07:48PM 521grammy wrote: Imartinsound, I don't know any particular resource, but if you live anywhere near the DFW metroplex, I know exactly where you should go.  Let us know if you find a good resource to search for breast surgeons.  I'll be glad to help if I can. 521grammy
Posts.Title: 25-Years-Old With Lumps and Bloody Discharge lmartinsound lmartinsound

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2014 10:39AM 521grammy wrote: Dear Pugs:  I had a biopsy on Wednesday, Sept. 3.  Unbelievably, I received my results only 24 hours later!  All 8 samples taken during the biopsy were benign.  I had 3 mammograms in the last few months, the last of which was rated as a BiRad 4C but all 8 samples were benign!  I'm writing to you now because the waiting nearly did me in.  I had my routine yearly mammogram in January 2014.  I was called back in for a density in my left breast and had a sonogram a couple of weeks later.  The results from the sonogram indicated the density was a cyst and was nothing to worry about.  However, they suggested I follow up in 4 months.  I kept putting off that 4-month follow up.  My primary care physician called 7 months after my sonogram and strongly urged me to follow up with another mammogram.  I had that follow-up mammogram on August 22nd.  I was shocked when they called me and said further testing needed to be done.  I was told there was a new cluster of microcalcifications on my August 22nd mammogram that had not shown up on the mammogram or sonogram in January.  Let the anxiety begin!  I had a diagnostic mammogram on August 29th which was the one rate a BiRad 4C.  They scheduled a biopsy for Sept. 3.  The waiting for the biopsy was brutal.  I was on an emotional rollercoaster of optimism and despair.  I spent way too much time on the internet which caused more anxiety and worry.  My husband begged me to stay off the internet.  Biopsy day came!  Thank goodness!  Everything was going well until the nurse realized I had a partial knee replacement in March 2014 and a second one in July 2014.  If they had known that before biopsy day, they would have put me on antibiotics for a day or two before the procedure.  I just knew they were going to send me home and make me reschedule the biopsy.  That was the last straw--I burst into tears.  Fortunately, I had one of God's angels for a nurse.  She called my orthopedic surgeon, got a prescription from him, and went to the pharmacy to pick it up for me!  I took 4 mega pills of antibiotics and waited for an hour and then completed the biopsy. I was told it would be about 48 hours before I received the results.  The rollercoaster was on full speed!  I tried to stay busy.  I read my devotionals and Bible.  I talked to friends and family.  Very unexpectedly, I received a call from the hospital only 24 hours after the procedure!  I was very very relieved, but I was still on that rollercoaster.  What was wrong with me!!!  It was benign!!!  I should be celebrating!!!  All I could do was cry.  It has now been 48 hours since that phone call and I'm finally feeling more like myself.  Both my husband and I feel that even after the biopsy and the good results, I was still trying to recover from all the stress and angst built up beginning with that BiRad 4C mammogram on August 29th.  I really did a number on myself.  I pray that you are handling your waiting better than I did.  I pray that your results are as wonderful as mine.  I'll keep on eye on this forum to see what your results are.  Warm regards from 521grammy.
Posts.Title: Had biopsy yesterday pugsnotdrugs nasturtium66

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2014 08:14PM 521grammy wrote: Dear peacejen: I had a stereotactic biopsy on my left breast right after Labor Day.  Fortunately, all samples taken were benign.  I was told to follow up with a 3D mammogram in 6 months.  I did not even question why 6 months and not 12.  I'm happy to do whatever they think I need to do!  If they want to keep a closer eye on me for awhile, I'm perfectly okay with that.  I don't think it means anything negative.  Hope you find some answers that will give you peace.  521grammy
Posts.Title: Follow up in 6 months? Worried. peacejen usnerlr
